page.name: Background Readings
page.intro: Read these articles when you start this course. These articles will provide background knowledge and a common vocabulary about UDL.
page.content:
These articles will provide background knowledge and a common vocabulary about UDL. Please read the following three articles: 

  1. Getting from Here to There: UDL, Global Positioning Systems, and Lessons for Improving Education [PDF]
    The first reading is from the UDL experts at CAST. It puts UDL into an everyday analogy, a GPS system in a car.

    Summary Sadly for education, the commonly available GPS exemplifies the principles and guidelines of Universal Design for Learning better than most educational curricula. This article draws playful and important parallels as it explores the features of the GPS through the lens of the UDL guidelines. Published in: Gordon, D.T., Gravel, J.W., & Schifter, L.A. (2009). A policy reader in universal design for learning (pp.5-18) Cambridge, MA: Harvard Education Press.
    (Optional: You may also read supporting documents.)

  2. UDL Guidelines [PDF]
    Download and save and/or print these UDL Guidelines. We will be referring to them often during the course.
    (Optional: You may also read supporting documents.)

  3. TEAL Center Fact Sheet on UDL [PDF] The third reading is a TEAL Center Fact Sheet on UDL. It makes explicit how UDL applies to the adult education context. Bookmark this Fact Sheet for future reference and share with colleagues. You also may download this fact sheet from the TEAL Web site.
